titleproper.value:
Guide to the Al Silverman Papers 
                    <lb/>
                    <date>1951-2003 </date>
                    <lb/>
                    <num>MSS 136</num>

author.value: Finding aid prepared by Processed by Tania Friedel and Mimi Martin, 2003-2004. Updated in 2013 by Laura Newsome.

creation.value:
This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit
                <date>2013-05-06T17:38-0400</date>

abstract.label: Abstract
abstract.value: The Al Silverman Papers document the working life and activities of sports writer Al Silverman, author of ten books and numerous essays. The collection includes materials related to Al Silverman's work as an author as well as his work as editor of Sport Magazine, editor and publisher at Viking Press, and CEO and chairman of Book of the Month Club. Included in these files are draft copies of articles and books, research, interviews, magazine and newspaper clippings, correspondence with editors, and fan mail.

p.value: Restrictions are in place for a small portion of the collection. The Book of the Month Club meeting minutes are closed until 2023. Audiovisual materials have not been preserved and are not available to researchers. Appointments are necessary to consult manuscript and archival materials.

Published citations should take the following form:
                <lb/>
                <lb/>Identification of item, date (if known); The Al Silverman Papers; MSS 136 ; box number; folder number; Fales Library and Special Collections, New York University Libraries.

In addition to his writing, Silverman also worked as an editor and publisher. He was editor of 
                <title render="italic">Sport Magazine</title> from 1951 to 1963 and was CEO and chairman of Book of the Month Club from 1972 to 1988. Most recently, Silverman served as editor and publisher at Viking Press from 1989 to 1997.

This series is a 2004 accretion to the Al Silverman papers. It includes research materials for, and drafts of 
                <title render="italic">It's Not Over 'Til It's Over</title>, a sports history book written by Silverman, published in 2002.

subject.value: American literature |y 20th century |x History and criticism.
Books and reading |z United States |x History |y 20th century.

dsc.value:
Series I: Author Files Subseries A: Paper Files Scope and Contents note

This subseries includes drafts of Silverman's books; drafts and copies of articles; and correspondence, fan mail and photographs related to these writings. Also included are correspondence, contracts and reviews from his tenure at Sport Magazine and Viking Press.

 Subseries A: Paper Files Scope and Contents note

This Subseries includes correspondence, annual reports, and memos from Silverman's tenure as CEO and chairman of Book of the Month Club.

 Conditions Governing Access

The Book of the Month Club meeting minutes are closed until 2023.
